A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The Last Jedi delivers\, in entertaining fashion\, a worthy addition to the Star Wars saga\, which both honors the previous installments while adding plenty of new lore\, and deftly defies viewer expectations. There are plenty of homages to the original stories to satisfy nostalgia\, but nothing feels out of place\, or patronizing\, as it is tightly woven into the story. While The Last Jedi is the darkest of the Star Wars movies\, it uses that mood to accentuate the moments of hope. The performances by the cast are among the finest in the entire saga\, and there are moments of true satisfaction throughout the movie. \nAnd of course\, John Williams' score is impeccable.
